comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When I try to save most of the inner pages from englishrussia.com (see the URL), Firefox 4 says:

E:\TEMP\New folder\English Russia » The Security To Trust_files\a.04em|15px|400|2813 could not be saved, because an unknown error occurred.

Try saving to a different location.

If I try to rename the html, the same occurs.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open webpage: http://englishrussia.com/index.php/2011/04/18/the-security-to-trust/
2. Press CTRL-S or File/Save Page as
3. Press Save button.
Actual Results:  
The error came and slap me right into the face:

E:\TEMP\New folder\English Russia » The Security To Trust_files\a.04em|15px|400|2813 could not be saved, because an unknown error occurred.

Try saving to a different location.


Expected Results:  
Save the page as expected and do not whine about errors.

Fix it ASAP, it works flawlessly in Chrome, but I shelved it in favor of FF4 (which is sadly fn slow ass).
comments.creator: dfandrew@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #6)
> Did you actually try what the Dialog suggests?
> "Try saving to a different location."
> 
> Can you save other Pages Content to the same Dir?
Ok, since you are lazy bastards. Here is the deal: If I check the source of the page, and search for the problematic javascript content, the url looks like this:

http://2leep.com/ticker2/1/custom/3/5/240/bottom/%23D8CDAA|black|Tahoma|1.4em|0.04em|15px|766|2813

Its urlencoded, the hash is marked with %23 etc. IF I click on it and save with ctrl+s, the filename becomes:

#D8CDAA_black_Tahoma_1.4em_0.04em_15px_766_2813.04em-15px-766-2813

Saved, ok.

If I copy the src and paste it into firefox's url bar and try to save it, the filename becomes:

#D8CDAA_black_Tahoma_1.4em_0.04em_15px_766_2813.04em-15px-766-2813.04em|15px|766|2813

And can't save it, I get the file name is not valid.

Now, the problem is, that with SAVE PAGE AS, Firefox incorrectly decodes the filename and try to save that, instead of saving it as an urlencoded string. So in correct it would look something like this:

%23D8CDAA%7Cblack%7CTahoma%7C1.4em%7C0.04em%7C15px%7C766%7C2813

So, there is your fukken problem. You are welcome.
comments.creator: dfandrew@gmail.com
